title: Map of land grant and contract - pattern

content.description:
Source 1Map Showing 400,000 acres Granted to 10,000 Freedpeople in January 1865
The map depicts lands granted to formerly enslaved people by General William T. Sherman under Special Field Orders No. 15 

Source 2
“This contract made and entered into...between Joel A. Light and Tom and his wife [Lydia].... 
[Joel] Light agrees to furnish the land [for farming] and horses and tools...[and supplies to farm and to give Tom and his wife] one third of the crop they...cultivate. The above named parties Tom [and] his wife [are] to...do all necessary work on the farm repairing [and] taking care and feeding [the animals] and the said Tom's wife is to assist in doing work about the house [and] to milk and cook when necessary. This contract is to continue for one year from this date.”
Source: Contract made in Tennessee between Joel Light and formerly enslaved people, Tom and Lydia, in the period after the Civil War
content.question: Which of the following describes the final result of the policy depicted in the map?

choices.label: It was revoked by President Andrew Johnson and land was returned to former owners or sold to northern investors.
It allowed Southern prisons to hire out convicts to farm land newly granted to freedmen.
It was used by President Abraham Lincoln to free enslaved people in Confederate states along the Atlantic coast.
It gave African American men access to the right to vote and enabled formal participation in politics.

content.answer: It was revoked by President Andrew Johnson and land was returned to former owners or sold to northern investors.
